instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Slow and fan spinning full blast
threads.message:
Hi there.

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 13" MacBook Pro. 2017 Year. I have no history of this MacBook. After removing bottom cover everything is clean and appears new. There is no indication any work has been done. Everything functions as it should, just high fan speed and system runs extremely slow. I removed the logic board and checked all areas of the board with my microscope and there is no corrosion anywhere. Where do I go from here?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Slow and fan spinning full blast
threads.message:
Should do a PRAM reset first.
Also test with other SSD, or USB macOS.

Try disconnecting webcam cable.
Run HWMonitor and look for any strange value.
Trackpad board/flex can generate this issue too.
